Class ConsoleMethods

java.lang.Object
ConsoleMethods
public class ConsoleMethods extends Object
Helper class that provides support for option selectors and other console-specific methods for different menus. It includes methods for printing options, handling option conditions, and managing the console screen.

      public ConsoleMethods()

  • Method Details

    • printOptions

      public static void printOptions(String[] options)
      Prints an array of options with a selector on the currently selected option.
      Parameters:
      options - An array of options to be printed.

    • optionCondition

      public static boolean optionCondition(int choiceNumber, String userInput)
      Checks if a specific option has been selected by the user.
      Parameters:
      choiceNumber - The number of the choice that the user is currently on.
      userInput - User input to check if the player has inputted .
      Returns:
      True if the specific option has been selected by the user, false otherwise.

    • arrowSelector

      public static void arrowSelector(String userInput, int maxChoices)
      Handles user input to scroll the selector up or down.
      Parameters:
      userInput - User input ("w" or "s") to scroll the selector.
      maxChoices - The maximum number of choices to determine the last option.

    • resetSelectedOption

      public static void resetSelectedOption()
      Resets the selected option to 0. Mostly used so that when another menu is opened, the selector starts from the topmost option.

    • refreshScreen

      public static void refreshScreen()
      Clears the console and resets the selected option.

    • clearConsole

      public static void clearConsole()
      Clears the console screen.

    • loadingScreen

      public static void loadingScreen()
      Displays a loading screen with three dots.

    • helpfulPrompt

      public static void helpfulPrompt()
      Displays instructions for navigating the menu.
